instruction: How were machine learning classifiers utilized in mapping and characterizing earthquake-induced rubble in urban areas using remote sensing techniques?
Output: Machine learning classifiers were utilized in mapping and characterizing earthquake-induced rubble in urban areas using remote sensing techniques by analyzing the hyperspectral signatures of various materials acquired on site. The Spectral Mixture Analysis, specifically the Sequential Maximum Angle Convex Cone algorithm, was used to derive the linear mixed model distribution of remotely sensed spectral responses of pure materials (endmembers). These endmembers were then mapped onto the hyperspectral signatures, and different machine learning classifiers were tested to assess their relative abundances. The C-Support Vector Machine provided the best results, allowing for the characterization of the main rubble constituents with an accuracy of up to 88.8% for less mixed pixels. Additionally, the Random Forest classifier was able to detect the likely presence of asbestos.
